issue.title: (SDF Spec) clarify the semantic of having multiple links in a model.

content.raw:
Somehow, on the premise that there are use cases where links in a model have to move freely w.r.t. each other ("the rubble pile argument"), the technical bits boil down to "it's easier to ADD fixed joints to make sure that links are rigidly connected together than REMOVE joints --- which you can't really do in a XML file. Would that be a fair summary ?

Given that rigidly attaching models together is a pretty common occurence (e.g. off-the-shelve parts like sensors), wouldn't it be a good thing to add a SDF shortcut for that (like a 'fixed' joint type) ? The answer I found on answers.gazebo.org about it (from you actually, saying that one should include a model in another if that's what they're looking for) does not seem to apply anymore. Currently, creating a fixed joint is something like 7-8 lines *and* requires to give a name to the joint (naming horror ...)
